other_tests.findings: Hematocrit values higher than the 99th percentile for age; periodic phlebotomies of 5 to 7 ml per kilogram since a few days old.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Phlebotomy is currently the main prophylactic treatment for symptoms such as severe headache and muscle cramps; however, it is described as detrimental in patients with Chuvash polycythemia.

other_tests.findings: GH peak of 33.6 ng/mL (normal response in mid-60s for this age group), indicating impairment in the GHRH–GH–IGF1 pathway.
Marked suppression in the patient's muscle mitochondrial respiratory capacity relative to control; oxidative phosphorylation capacity supported by fatty acids was 28% lower.
High levels of unusual intermitochondrial connecting ducts observed.
Low levels of glycolytic intermediates (81-98% lower) and alterations in glucose and lipid metabolism were noted.
